result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. Skenandore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay buy money of $75.  Work out payment with agent.
Pay DNA surcharge of $250. Work out payment with agent.
All other fines/costs remitted.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 12-19-18.
Pay DNA surcharge.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
No association with known drug users except in a treatment setting.
Assessments, counseling and follow through as determined by agent.
